title: Quiz - Changes in Industrial and Labour Policy

quiz.text: ​Which of the following is/are correct regarding Industrial Policy in context of India?  1. Industrial policy means the procedures, principles, policies, rules and regulations which control the industrial undertaking of the country and pattern of industrialization.  2. The industrial policy in the pre-reform period i.e. before 1991 put greater emphasis on the private sector intervention in the field of industrial development.  3. During late 70’s and 80’s, Government initiated liberalization measures in the industrial policy framework.  4. The drastic liberalization measures were carried out by India in 1991.​
options: 1,2 and 3
2,3 and 4
1, 3 and 4
1, 2, 3 and 4
2 and 3 only

quiz.text: Which of the following is not one of the subjects in Union List of constitution?
options: Regulation of labour and safety in mines and oil-fields
Trade Unions, Industrial and labour disputes
Industrial disputes concerning Union employees.
Union agencies and institutions for professional, vocational or technical training, including the training of police officer etc.
None of the options given above

quiz.text: Which of the following attached offices of Ministry of Labour is responsible for collection, compilation and dissemination of labor statistics, construction and maintenance of working class consumer price index numbers (WC-CPI) for selected centers and all India basis for industrial workers, construction of CPI numbers for agricultural and rural workers?
options: Office of Chief Labor Commissioner
Labor Bureau
Directorate General of Employment
Central Government Industrial Tribunals and Labour Courts
None of the options given above

quiz.text: Employee State Insurance Corporation (ESIC) is an autonomous corporation under which of the following Ministry of the Government of India?
options: Ministry of Labour and Employment
Minsitry of Social Justice and Empowerment
Ministry of  Personnel, Public Grievances, and Pensions
Ministry of Finance
Ministry of Home Affairs

quiz.text: Which of the following is incorrect regarding Employees Provident Fund Organisation?
options: It is an Organization tasked to assist the Central Board of Trustees, a statutory body formed by the Employees' Provident Fund and Miscellaneous Provisions Act, 1952
It is under the administrative control of the Ministry of Labour and Employment, Government of India
It is also the nodal agency for implementing Bilateral Social Security Agreements with other countries on a reciprocal basis
It is the largest social security organisation in the world in terms of the number of covered beneficiaries.
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following is incorrect regarding International Labour Organization (ILO)?
options: It was founded in 1945 to mitigate the hardships caused by second world war.
It became first specialized agency under United Nations in 1945
Its vision is to secure humane working conditions for workers and to attain social justice for them universally
It is credited with giving 4 core standards on labor which are part of general human rights as per UN declarations
It received the Nobel Prize in 1969

quiz.text: Which of the following laws are not subsumed under Code on Wages , 2019?
options: Minimum Wages Act, 1948
Payment of Wages Act, 1936
Payment of Bonus Act, 1965
Equal Remuneration Act, 1976
None of the above

quiz.text: Anybody who wishes to develop a SEZ submits a proposal to the Board of Approval (BoA). A Single Window approval mechanism has been provided through a 19 member inter-ministerial Board of Approval (BoA). BOA is headed by:
options: Secretary, Department of Economic Affairs
Secretary, Department of Commerce
Finance Minister
Chief Economic Advisor (CEA)
None of the  above

quiz.text: Which of the following is incorrect regarding Special Economic Zones (SEZ)?
options: An SEZ is a territory within a country that is typically duty-free (Fiscal Concession) and has different business and commercial laws chiefly to encourage investment and create employment.
The domestic sales from the SEZ are exempt from all kinds of custom duties
The Special Economic Zones Act was passed in 2005
The Board of Approval is the apex body and is headed by the Secretary, Department of Commerce (Ministry of Commerce and Industry).
The Baba Kalyani led committee was constituted by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry to study the existing SEZ policy of India

quiz.text: Who among the following can set up SEZs?
options: Any private/ public/ joint sector
State Government
Foreign Company
All of the above
Both A and B

quiz.text: Which of the following is incorrect with regard to Free Trade and Warehousing Zones (FTWZ)?
options: They are special category of Special Economic Zones
They focus on trading and warehousing.
FDI is strictly prohibited in this zones
These Zones would be established in areas proximate to seaports, airports or dry ports so as to offer easy access by rail and road
There are 8 approved Free Trade and Warehousing Zones (FTWZs) in India.

quiz.text: For the SEZ, the Government specifies certain conditions. One of the conditions is that in a Special Economic Zone (SEZ):
options: 15% of the area of the SEZ must be used only for export related activities
25% of the area of the SEZ must be used only for export related activities
45% of the area of the SEZ must be used only for export related activities
65% of the area of the SEZ must be used only for export related activities
75% of the area of the SEZ must be used only for export-related activities

quiz.text:
Which of the following is not one of the core standards of labor as given by the International Labour Organisation and also part of general human rights as per UN declarations? 
  1. Freedom of Association, Right to Organize, and Right to Collective Bargaining 
  2. Abolition of forced labor 
  3. Minimum age of employment and abolition of child labor 
  4. Prohibition on workplace discrimination and Equal pay for men and women for work of equal value
options: 1 and 2 only
2 and 3 only
3 only
3 and 4 only
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following factors points to the need for urgent labour reforms in India?  1. Low employment  2. Benefits of labour laws only limited to the Organized sector  3. Multiplicity of labour laws  4.  Lack of Global Competitiveness
options: 1, 2 and 3 only
2,3 and 4 only
1,2 and 4 only
1,2,3 and 4
1 and 2 only

quiz.text: Which of the following is incorrect regarding National Manufacturing Policy, 2011?
options: The policy aims to increase the share of manufacturing in the country’s GDP to 20% by 2022
The policy aims to create 100 million additional jobs in the next decade.
The policy envisages establishment of National Investment and Manufacturing Zones (NIMZ) equipped with world-class infrastructure
The policy embodies an easy exit policy and single window clearance in zones
None of the  above

quiz.text: Which of the following industry verticals are to be given special incentives under National Manufacturing Policy, 2011?  1. Employment intensive industries  2. Capital Goods industries  3. Strategic Industries  4. Small and Medium Enterprises
options: 1,2 and 3
2,3 and 4
1,3 and 4
1,2,3 and 4
1 and 2 only

quiz.text: Which of the following is/are correct regarding East Coast Economic Corridor?  1. It is India’s first coastal economic corridor along its eastern coast. 2. It stretches about 2500 kms from Kolkata in the north to Kanyakumari in the south.  3. The project would have two dimensions: infrastructure development and investments for node centric development.
options: 1 and 2 only
2 and 3 only
1 and 3 only
1,2 and 3
2 only

quiz.text:
Which of the following is/are correct regarding the Industrial Policies of India after Independence?
  1. The main thrust of the Industrial Policy Resolution, of 1948 was to lay down the foundation of a mixed economy whereby the private and public sector was accepted as important components in the development of the industrial economy of India. 
  2. The Policy Statement of 1973 drew up a list of industries to be started by large business houses so that the competitive effort of small industries was not affected.
  3. Industrial Policy Resolution, 1977 divided the industries into three categories: Schedule A, Schedule B, and Schedule C. 
  4. The industrial policy 1980 emphasized that the public sector is the pillar of economic infrastructure for reasons of its greater reliability, need for large investments, and long gestation periods in key projects.
options: 1,2 and 3
1,2 and 4
2,3 and 4
1,2,3 and 4
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following is incorrect regarding Industrial Policy Statement, 1977?  1. The main thrust of the new industrial policy was an effective promotion of cottage and small industries.  2. The policy followed a restrictive approach towards the large-scale sector and they were allowed in basic, capital goods, and high-tech industries.  3. The industrial policy stated that the public sector should be used only in strategic areas.  4. The policy statement advocated more freedom for foreign investment and gave them a majority share in the ownership and effective control in select industries.
options: 3 and 4 only
2, 3 and 4 only
1, 2 and 4 only
1, 2 and 3 only
1 and 2 only

quiz.text:
Which of the following is/are correct regarding the Industries (Development and Regulation) Act (IDRA), 1951? 
  1. IDRA, 1951 gave powers to the government to regulate the industry in a number of ways. 
  2. It contains all measures to curb unfair trade practices.
  3. The government has the power to cancel the license granted to the industrial unit if found, engaging in wrongful behavior.
options: 1 and 2 only
2 and 3 only
1 and 3 only
1, 2 and 3
1 only

quiz.text: Which of the following is incorrect regarding National Industrial Corridor Development And Implementation Trust (NICDIT)?
options: Government of India has accorded approval for expanding the mandate of Delhi Mumbai Industrial Corridor Project Implementation Trust Fund (DMIC-PITF) and it has been re-designated it as National Industrial Corridor Development and Implementation Trust (NICDIT).
NICDIT will function under the administrative control of the Department of Economic Affairs.
NICDIT will take up new Industrial Corridors, Nodes, Early Bird Projects and Standalone Projects on the recommendation of State Governments.

It will develop the overall enabling institutional, funding, and operational framework for the Industrial Corridors; support project development activities through a Knowledge Partner for the Industrial Corridors and agencies like SPVs and State Governments.
None of the  above

quiz.text:
Consider the following statements with respect to the Industrial Policy Resolution, 1948:
  1. The main thrust of IPR, 1948 was to lay down the foundation of a mixed economy whereby the private and public sector was accepted as important components in the development of the industrial economy of India
  2. It gave the private sector a vast area to operate
  3. Government took the role of a catalytic agent of industrial development
Choose the correct option using the code given below:
options: 1 only
1 and 2 only
1 and 3 only
2 and 3 only
1, 2 and 3

quiz.text: Consider the following with respect to Industrial Policy Resolution, 1956: 1) IPR, 1956 divided the industries into the following four categories 2) IPR, 1956 emphasized the mutual existence of public and private sector industries 3) The basic rationale of IPR, 1956 was that the state had to be given primary role for industrial development as capital was scarce and entrepreneurship was not strong Choose the correct option using the code given below:
options: 1 and 3 only
2 and 3 only
1 and 2 only
1 only
1, 2 and 3

quiz.text: On the basis of recommendation of the Monopolies commission, when was Monopolistic and Restrictive Trade Practices Act (MRTP Act) encated?
options: 1965
1966
1967
1968
1969

quiz.text: Which of the following factor led to New Industrial Policy of 1991?
options: Due to the Gulf War, the higher oil prices were rapidly depleting India’s foreign reserves
Inflation peaking at nearly 14 per cent
Sharp decline in the private remittances from the overseas Indian workers
The gross fiscal deficit of the Central Government reaching 8.4 per cent of the GDP
All of the above

quiz.text:
Consider the following statements with respect to the New Industrial Policy of 1991: 
  1. The industries which were reserved for the Central Government by the IPR, 1956, were cut down to only ten.
  2. The number of industries put under the compulsory provision of licensing was cut down to only twenty.
  3. Support was enhanced to the small-scale sector.
Choose the correct option using the code given below:
options: 1 only
1 and 2 only
3 only
2 and 3 only
1, 2 and 3

quiz.text: MSME’s are classified as per their turnover and investment. The new classifications of Micro enterprises as per the Aatma Nirbhar Bharat Abhiyan Scheme in 2020 is:
options: Investment is less than 10 crore; Turnover less than 5 crore
Investment is less than 5 crore; Turnover less than 3 crore
Investment is less than 1 crore; Turnover less than 3 crore
Investment is less than 1 crore; Turnover less than 6 crore
Investment is less than 1 crore; Turnover less than 5 crore

quiz.text: MSME’s are classified as per their turnover and investment. The new classifications of Small enterprises as per the Aatma Nirbhar Bharat Abhiyan Scheme in 2020 is:
options: Investment is less than 10 crore; Turnover less than 10 crore
Investment is less than 20 crore; Turnover less than 5 crore
Investment is less than 5 crore; Turnover less than 15 crore
Investment is less than 10 crore; Turnover less than 50 crore
Investment is less than 10 crore; Turnover less than 5 crore

quiz.text: MSME’s are classified as per their turnover and investment. The new classifications of Medium enterprises as per the Aatma Nirbhar Bharat Abhiyan Scheme in 2020 is:
options: Investment is less than 10 crore; Turnover less than 50 crore
Investment is less than 15 crore; Turnover less than 50 crore
Investment is less than 50 crore; Turnover less than 250 crore
Investment is less than 100 crore; Turnover less than 250 crore
Investment is less than 50 crore; Turnover less than 500 crore

quiz.text: National Manufacturing Policy was launched in which of the following year?
options: 2012
2010
2011
2013
2015

quiz.text: The National Manufacturing Policy aims to increase the share of manufacturing in the country’s GDP to:
options: 20% by 2022
25% by 2025
32% by 2022
16% by 2022
25% by 2022

quiz.text:
What is/are the recent policy initiative(s) of the Government of India to promote the growth of the manufacturing sector? 
  1. Setting up of National Investment and Manufacturing Zones. 
  2. Providing the benefit of 'single window clearance'. 
  3. Establishing the Technology Acquisition and Development Fund. 
Select the correct answer using the codes given below:
options: 1 only
2 and 3 only
1 and 3 only
1, 2 and 3
1 and 2 only

quiz.text: Index of Industrial Production (IIP) is compiled and published by which of the following?
options: Reserve Bank of India
SIDBI
National Statistical Office
Ministry of Home Affairs
SEBI

quiz.text: The programme "The Make in India" was started on
options: November 2012
September 2014
January 2014
September 2016
March 2019

quiz.text: Which of the following is not a part of the eight core industries that comprise?
options: Electircity
Crude oil
Cement
Technology
Fertilizers

quiz.text: In the 'Index of Eight Core Industries', which one of the following is given the highest weight?
options: Coal production
Electricity generation
Fertilizer production
Steel production
Coal Production

quiz.text: Which of the following has lowest weightage in Eight Core Industries?
options: Cement Industry
Natural Gas Industry
Crude Oil Industry
Fertilizers Industry
Coal Industry

quiz.text: The Industrial Policy, of 1991 was criticized on a number of points. Which of the following was not one of them?
options: Erratic industrial growth
Threat from foreign competition
Neglect of agriculture sector
Misplaced faith in foreign investment
None of the above

quiz.text: Who among the following declared the First Industrial Policy in the Post Independence Period?
options: Jawahar Lal Nehru
Shyama Prasad Mukherjee
Rafi Ahmed Kidwai
Bayya Suryanarayana Murthy
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following is not the salient feature of the industrial policy developments since 1991?
options: The scope of the private sector has been enormously expanded.
Public sector has been withdrawing partially or fully from several of the enterprises by divestment.
The Indian industry is increasingly exposed to foreign competition
Monopoly or dominant position for the public sector in most of the industries and control of the commanding heights of the economy by the public sector.
None of the above
